TowerDefense

Class SetOfTowers

  • java.lang.Object
    • TowerDefense.SetOfTowers

  • public class SetOfTowers
extends java.lang.Object
    This creates an interface for user interactions with a list of Towers. Not consistent with SetOfWalkers, which should be addressed.
    Author:
    Branden Drake, Rachel Horton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SetOfTowers()
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addTowerAt(Tile tile)
      Creates a new tower (a Medic) at the corresponding tile and stores it in this set.
      boolean addTowerAt(Tile tile, boolean towerIsMedic)
      Creates a new tower at the corresponding tile and stores it in this set.
      Tower[] getArrayOfTowers()
      Returns an array of the Towers in the current set.
      boolean isEmpty() 
      void removeAll()
      Empty the list of Towers and destroy them all.
      void update()
      Updates the list and all the Towers within.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SetOfTowers

        public SetOfTowers()
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the list and all the Towers within.

      • addTowerAt

        public boolean addTowerAt(Tile tile)
        Creates a new tower (a Medic) at the corresponding tile and stores it in this set.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile at which to create the Tower
        Returns:
        True if the tower was created

      • addTowerAt

        public boolean addTowerAt(Tile tile,
                          boolean towerIsMedic)
        Creates a new tower at the corresponding tile and stores it in this set.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile at which to create the Tower
        towerIsMedic - True if the Tower should be a Medic, false if it should be Speedy.
        Returns:
        True if the tower was created.

      • getArrayOfTowers

        public Tower[] getArrayOfTowers()
        Returns an array of the Towers in the current set. Intended to be used to iterate through the list of Towers for the purpose of simple checks and sets. Note that this array will not be updated after this call, so keeping it around is not a good idea.
        Returns:
        The current set of Towers as an array.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the set contains no Towers

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Empty the list of Towers and destroy them all.
